pros: There's plenty of opportunity to make money if you are passionate.
cons: Coverage is hard to find

review_title: Easy enough, but will become frustrating
years_at_company: Easy enough, but will become frustrating
pros: Pretty laid back, depending on your owner/management. I worked in a busy office so there wasn't a lot of time for down time although this didn't make the day go by quickly necessarily, patients were nice but I would usually see over 80 a day.
cons: No lunch break, no benefits, no room for advancement or promotion in most cases, incentive to up-sell wasn't enough, patients love to not listen when you explain terms and conditions of membership.
advice_to_mgmt: Pay your loyal employees what they deserve. Working people to death without showing appreciation is the fastest way to lose good people. I worked with great chiropractors but they all felt under-valued which just makes in hard to go into work everyday.

pros: Steady employment. Meet lots of contacts.
cons: Not much room for promotion

pros: You could receive free adjustments
cons: Horrible wages and lack of patient care

review_title: Good or Bad Depending On Clinic Owner
years_at_company: Good or Bad Depending On Clinic Owner
pros: Focus on patient care alone, delivering high quality adjustments to 50+ patients per day, seeing amazing results with evidence based Chiropractic care alone!
cons: Feeling undervalued, unappreciated, overworked, underpaid, with no job security. Apparently, quality of care is a much lower priority than one's willingness to work as humanly possible for the least amount of pay.
advice_to_mgmt: Treat your Doctors with respect and appreciation by paying them a fair market rate salary with incentives and rewards for increased production. All of your income comes directly from the manual adjustments your hard working Doctors provide!

review_title: Not a bad thing to do for awhile
years_at_company: Not a bad thing to do for awhile
pros: Low stress, gives you exposure to a pretty high volume of patients (depending on location, these are franchises), improve on the speed of your treatment, company manages all the marketing, can be flexible if you work elsewhere.
cons: Depends on your owner in many cases, 9 hour shifts with no designated breaks for lunch or anything else, pay is by the day rather by volume of patients seen while they push you to chase patient numbers anyways, low benefits for most positions, low pay for volume of patients you’ll see, limited growth potential, may get a complacent clinic owner calling the shots, negatively affected when patients don’t sign up for a plan (which is fairly common in other clinics, but seems contradictory to the walk in nature of this clinic model)
advice_to_mgmt: Pay doctors better, and per patient

pros: Got experience and a salary instead of relying on insurance to pay you
cons: Sell treatment plans and maintenance plan

review_title: Great model. Horrible place to work.
years_at_company: Great model. Horrible place to work.
pros: Easy. All you do is adjust patients and perform periodic exams. Good for docs looking for more hands on experience or who just want to make a few extra bucks on the side.
cons: Company could care less about you. Basically their goal is to work you as hard as they can until you either injur yourself or quit at which point they’ll kick you out the door and bring in their next victim. They pay peanuts and the benefits are laughable. I’ve never seen a company care so little about any of their employees. It’s so bad the company is actually built around turnover because they know people won’t stay long term. Additionally, there is essentially zero room for advancement or any significant pay raises.
advice_to_mgmt: Show your employees some respect and pay them a respectable wage. Make it so they want to stay instead of using it as a stepping stone.

pros: Free Chiropractic care, and awesome caring doctors! Some opportunity to get commissions
cons: Some of the patients are rude, pay is not great, hard to earn enough commissions, always have to up sell the patients
advice_to_mgmt: Higher hourly pay would decrease turnover!

pros: Professionally run clinic, clean and very busy. The staff and the other Doc’s are great to work with. I’ve been with The Joint for a year and look forward expanding opportunities in the near future.
cons: None that I have experienced.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the good work and the professional manner the clinic is run.

pros: The ability to treat and heal patients and improve quality of life through affordable chiropractic care.
cons: The owner was horrible (and not a chiropractor). We often did not get a lunch and were elected to work 9 straight hours. We were understaffed so doctors got burnt out quickly. Stay away if you can!
advice_to_mgmt: Treat doctors better.

pros: Subluxation based chiropractic with above down inside out philosophy at its core. Local advertising and lots of referrals from happy patients keep new ones coming in. I get to talk chiropractic and adjust all day and I love it! Beautiful and spotless office is a pleasure to work in. Patient flow is seamless due to a well trained front desk staff, even when it gets really busy. Management is fantastic lets me be the doctor and always very open to feedback.
cons: No scheduled lunch. But plenty of down time and how long does it really take to eat a grass fed burger?

pros:
Flexible schedule w/ major holidays off.
Employees are entitled to free chiropractic adjustments.
Performance bonuses available
Positive and fun work culture - based on my experience at the Hoboken location.
cons:
Long work day
Need to be able to multi task
Uniform
advice_to_mgmt: No advice to give, I had a great experience with the management team.

pros: Great for part-time work, especially for those interested in Health & Wellness. Really great management, work environment, and exceptional chiropractors, you even get free adjustments! Generally low stress, with room to grow within clinic
cons: No scheduled breaks. Not having to schedule appointments sounds great until everyone comes in at the same time, wouldn't recommend for those who can't prioritize tasks or efficiently manage time.

pros:
Nice people
Chiropractic is good for you
cons:
Didn’t like the boss
Too pushy

pros: Easy, good hours, bonus incentive
cons: Management always changed, rules always changed, hard to get a raise
advice_to_mgmt: Keep a manager for longer than a few months

pros: Employees are entitled to chiropractic adjustments.
cons: No benefits available even to FT employees. Additionally VERY little incentive to "sell".

pros: commission and great management. Free adjustments.
cons: hours are long, adding words for review
advice_to_mgmt: have 2 shifts instead of one

pros:
-3 day work week
-Little to no marketing
-Great pay/bonus structure
-Easy to work with franchisee owners (also chiropractors)
-Monthly meetings so everyone stays up to date on current promotions
cons:
-No guaranteed lunch break
-Long work days (10 hour shifts)
-No health insurance
advice_to_mgmt: Consider Health benefits

pros: Great service offered, along with great people to work with.
cons: Sales. But that is about it, everything else was great.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the good work.

pros: You get to actually concentrate on providing Chiropractic adjustments without the headache of dealing with insurance companies. Patient care is in your hands, not a 3rd party administrator. You get to be a Chiropractor not a physical therapy provider who also adjusts. Because of the convenient hours and affordable cost, we are providing Chiropractic care to a greater number of people than would have gone to a Chiropractor before.
cons: Working within any Corporate structure for healthcare presents with occasional challenges.

review_title: Treat the patient not the policy
years_at_company: Treat the patient not the policy
pros: Cash based wellness care that allows you to treat patients rather than treating their insurance policy. Great company to work for. I got into chiropractic care to be a treating doctor and this has given me the most opportunity to just be a doctor!
cons: Can be very fast paced.

pros: Plenty of patients to adjust
cons: Low cost makes us look questionable
advice_to_mgmt: Cross market with gyms, massage, and acupuncture

pros: Free adjustments, holidays off. Decor is nice
cons: No Benefits, No vacation time, Hard to find coverage, little to no resource as far as technology goes. Systems confusing and seemingly outdated. Expect to do everything from janitorial to customer service. Many of the Dr’s are arrogant and unhelpful. Minimal excuses for bonuses . The concept of walk-in appointments is great but not always functional when it starts to get busy. Scheduling new patients is a pain since they don’t want it done. No time to yourself for lunches. Pay rate listed online is bait. Not true pay rate given. No raises, work schedule is constantly moving. Everyone is essentially over worked and under paid. Owners only allow ordering of clinic produce very few months.
advice_to_mgmt: Hire more coordinators, look into benefits, figure out lunch scheduling so that people can at least have a few minutes to themselves to unravel, hire a janitorial service. 10 hour days block off way too much of someone’s day.

pros: If you're fresh out of Chiropractic school and you feel like you need a lot of practice improving your adjusting skills these places will give you the patient load to get it.
cons: The overall model of The Joint is a complete disgrace to what Chiropractic Medicine has worked so hard to become over the last 60 years. Minimal exam, no treatment other than the adjustment, maximum allowed time spent with each patient per visit is 5 min. I sincerely hope that the franchise model fails just like the corporate model did.
advice_to_mgmt: Stop maligning Chiropractic Medicine

pros: Some equipment provided, front desk assistant
cons: High volume, little time for notes or pt education.
advice_to_mgmt: Value Drs. and you will be able to hire and keep more

pros: Work life balance is good
cons: Pay and hours not so good

pros: Supposedly, you don't have to worry about anything but treating patients. However, the front desk is so poorly trained, you end up dealing with cleaning up their messes way too frequently. Front desk rotates through a new person every five weeks, so consistency is absent.
cons: The Joint franchises in the Raleigh-Durham area are run like a retail store and not a healthcare facility. Ownership is so cheap, they put a water restictor on the bathroom faucet so water costs are kept down. Front desk is told they will get hourly bonuses, but staff soon learns their formula for achieving additional pay is stacked in the owner's favor. Owners do not follow corporate bonus structure, which is to pay $5 for every person signed up on an initial two month deal. Zero benefits- no surprise there.

pros: Flexible Schedule and boss was very easy going
cons: Pay raise can be difficult

pros: Good pay. Good adjusting experience.
cons: Long hours and sometimes have to work weekends.

review_title: High volume work is hard, but they pay you
years_at_company: High volume work is hard, but they pay you
pros: Chiropractor can just be a chiropractor and take care of people. There's none of the business side to take care of.
cons: Long hours, high volume work that takes a physical toll on you.
advice_to_mgmt: More training for incoming chiropractors.

pros: Since clinics are open 7 days/week, it's possible to have alternate shifts, pick up extra shifts, work around a school schedule, etc. The clinic hours don't require driving in rush hour traffic (10 - 7 weekdays, 10-5 weekends). Clinics close on major holidays. The current Area Sales Manager is amazing, innovative and extremely smart. She has implemented many tools and protocols that made the job and team flow so much more productively.
cons: Corporate doesn't allow enough freedom for the Area Sales Manager. She could do more if they didn't restrain her. But that's just how corporations are.

pros: Easy job, nice doctors, you have time for personal things
cons: NO Benefits, sometimes very rude clienst

pros: Able to focus on patient care. Easy to recommend care that is very affordable in comparison.
cons: Lack of growth financially, disconnect from employees to owners and corporate. Lack of benefits offered from individual owners and corporate.

pros: Good people,Free Adjustments,Commission ,Location,Culture. The people are represent good meaning to chiropractic
cons:
Too corporate
cant grow

pros: Working as a chiropractic assistant gets me free care, and increases my knowledge on what chiropractic entails.
cons: The Joint does not offer full time positions as they do not provide benefits.
advice_to_mgmt: Corporation does not treat employees with respect or give opportunities for promotions. Commission is pathetic. Doctor's are not paid what they deserve.

pros: No one breathing down your neck telling you what to do. Relaxed and enjoyable atmosphere.
cons: Terrible pay!!!!! It can be difficult to get in the required lunch break.
advice_to_mgmt: Pay your doctors a respectable wage which would very likely reduce the revolving door of doctors coming and going.

review_title: Very nice company to work for!
years_at_company: Very nice company to work for!
pros: Decent hours, very easy job, you will miss rush hour traffic, shorter hours on the weekends, get home in time to still enjoy the evening
cons: They say you get breaks but usually you don’t, only one front desk person and one doctor, occasional long wait times for patients

pros: I have been working for The Joint since December 2017. This is by far the best job I have had. The owners/management are nice, supportive, and invested in their employees. We work together between the clinics to provide the best experience, possible. I have learned so much from the different Doctor of Chiropractic.
cons: I do not have any cons

pros: The Joint Chiropractic is the delivery of chiropractic services in a convenient retail setting. Managing professionals is rewarding. I like receiving free chiropractic services as an employee.
cons: Managing multiple offices can be difficult.
advice_to_mgmt: Two offices per manager

pros: This is an amazing company with an incredible amount of positive and talented people.
cons: We need nationwide insurance benefits.
advice_to_mgmt: Management is extremely supportive.

pros: allows us to focus on the treatment of the patient without the hassles of paperwork and insurance as in a traditional practice
cons: I cant think of anything negative

pros: The Joint Chiropractic is changing the chiropractic profession! Getting back to the basics of providing convenient, affordable chiropractic care... without all the bells and whistles. To do well with The Joint, you've got to be able to deliver quality adjustments. There's no therapies to hide behind. This business model allows you to do what you went to school for: adjust patients and provide care with CHIROPRACTIC.
cons: None: you put in long days, but get several days off to recover. I like their work schedule better than the standard choppy days most DCs maintain.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to provide support for the Chiropractors.

pros: I enjoy my position as the The Joint/Arboretum as I have the chance to deliver high quality chiropractic care at a very affordable price. As it is my mission to assist as many people live the most vital life possible, the Joint is a great vehicle for me to accomplish this goal. In addition, the specific owners of our particular Joint clinics are chiropractors themselves, so they understand the chiropractors that work on their team.
cons: I am not crazy about working weekends

pros: Fast paced working environment. We are paid on sliding base scale(hourly pay or per patient visit whichever pays higher) This makes it amazingly easy to set my monthly budget and everything above that is gravy. I have only been paid on base pay once and we were hit with a huge cold front that week and it was my second week at the practice. After 3 weeks my pay had increased above what I made at my prior clinic of 2.5 years. I have dropped from 4.5 days per week to 4 days per week within 3 months of being here and still make substantially more than I did when I started/previous clinic. I had a family emergency come up and the GM immediately got my clinic taken care of and was very supportive during the entire process I've never had that type of care at any other employer.
cons: Open on Sundays which makes it harder to be connected at church. New patients walking in 1 minute before closing without new patient paperwork.

pros:
I have been an employee with The Joint Chiropractic for over 2 years now and I absolutely love my job. I am a mother of 4 young children, so having a job I love and enjoy going to is important since it does take me away from my children and family. What I enjoy most about my job is getting to see the patients on their chiropractic journey. Many patients will come in bent over and can barely walk and are in so much pain, and being able to offer affordable chiropractic care to help them stand up straight and get them on the road to feeling better is just something great to see. Because so many of our patients come in on a weekly basis, you really become invested in your patients and their well-being.

The company itself is invested in their employees. It is important for me to feel like I matter to an employer and this is what keeps me as an employee with The Joint. The Clinic Director and ASM in my territory are beyond helpful and work well together.
cons: I do not have anything negative to say.

review_title: Worked for much less money than was deserved.
years_at_company: Worked for much less money than was deserved.
pros:
Not a hard job
Customers can be very nice but if you don’t tell them everything they will blame you for losing money
cons:
Not good pay
High turnover because you make the bosses all the money for them instead of getting paid like you are owed.
advice_to_mgmt: Pay better

pros: Positive work environment and great staff.
cons: no room for growth, good for a college student

pros: Most patients are super nice and interesting.
cons: Numbers matter. Being in charge of accounts due is awful. having your sales numbers be lowered from walk-in visits seems wrong. If your Dr. is bad your sales are bad.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the positive reinforcement of wellness coordinators, it goes a long way!

review_title: Love the job, & Staff But District Manager not so much.
years_at_company: Love the job, & Staff But District Manager not so much.
pros: Flexible schedule, great staff, commission and pay is pretty decent. Lots of resources for employees. Really a good company to work for. Must love working with people, and working in an office setting, oh and I can’t forget the free adjustments that the employees receive. Clinics are provided with Mini fridges and a micro for our lunch and a small office/break room.
cons: You could be doing 5 things right but only focus on the 1 thing that you’re having trouble with. Corporate is really on its employees about conversions.
advice_to_mgmt: Learn how to mange and talk to your employees. Maybe a training for the District Managers...

pros: gain some experience, guaranteed paycheck
cons: disrespectful to doctors, no benefits, disregard to patients, heavy workload, no scheduled lunch time in corporate offices, money hungry philosophy
advice_to_mgmt: get a reality check, chiropractic is about health and wellness not screwing people into signing up for eternal care they don't need.

pros: Commission bonus can be nice
cons: A lot of pressure on selling memberships
advice_to_mgmt: Be more realistic with goals

pros: Good pay and benefits. Easy job.
cons: Typically corporate treatment. Employees are nothing but a number to them. The last thing this company cares about is the employees and patients. It doesn’t matter to management if patients get better, all that matters is that patients keep spending money FOREVER.
advice_to_mgmt: Treat your employees well and they will stick around. If employees are happy the company will be more successful

pros: Great team-environment, wonderful sales training, clients love coming into the clinics - there are very few negative customer service experiences.
cons: There are very few benefits. You may have to travel to clinics that are up to 25 miles away from your home clinic to cover shifts.

pros: Getting to know and build relationships with the customers/patients coming in each day was the highlight of this job. Depending on the location, the job can be fairly easy.
cons: Management is less than desirable. It seems that the management team is a revolving door of people told to do the same thing over and over again that does not yield the desired result. They continue to increase the amount of responsibilities Wellness Coordinators have without any compensation. Wellness Coordinators are also expected to go above and beyond without any real support from management. Corporate is pretty clueless as to what is happening in each location every day, very money driven and doesn't invest much in employees
advice_to_mgmt: Get to know and understand what is happening within each location, as they are all different. Pay Wellness Coordinators what they deserve for what you are expecting of them each day.

pros: Great patients, daily/weekly adjustments for FREE, cute work attire, super easy to sell packages and make commission!
cons: I don't have any complaints working here.

pros: nice people to work with
cons: you will work for peanuts

pros: No marketing, streamlined computer system, focus on patient care
cons: High volume which can create doctor burnout and turnover, no breaks, lunch, etc

pros: Opportunity to work varying hours . Outlying and sticking to the bonus structure . As the company grow , so will your bonus which is very transparent .
cons: Too much chasing the latest shiny star . Demanded to do too many activities during non schedule working hours .
advice_to_mgmt: Create a manual for wanted protocol . Let it be put together in a binary fashion so pages can be easily or added or subtracted.

pros: Great D.C.'s to work with as well as wellness coordinators!
cons: Corporate staff can be very "corporate" and changing expectations suddenly.

pros: Flexible hours, great management, amazing patients
cons: Commission rates, conversion rates, full-time employees think they are managers.
advice_to_mgmt: Dont focus on conversion, if patients are happy, the sales will come. Also, the number of active members will grow with quality staff. If you have a bunch of declined members, dont keep them over a certain time period. You would rather have Quality patients over Quantity.

pros: Excellent for building hands on experience due to large patient loads. If you want to be an expert at HVLA adjusting this is a great office to get the experience.
cons: Walk in clinic means patient flow fluctuates throughout the day. Could have 10-70 patient over an eight hour work day.
advice_to_mgmt: Compensation is low for the amount of work in a busy office.

pros: Allows the doctors to practice and perfect very good adjusting skills. Regular hours. Much less paperwork//notes than if working with insurance/Medicare.
cons: Don't cover CEUs. Long hours with no set lunchtime or breaks. No appointments so can go from zero to over a dozen patients in an hour. Difficult to use any time off since it can be hard to get coverage doctors.
advice_to_mgmt: Find a better way to manage the hours. Nine hours of work with no breaks can be grueling and leads to quick burnout. This is a tough job on the doctor's body, provide some way to help, i.e. set break times, access to free massages on days off, perhaps some soft tissue tools to help ease work on the doctor's hands. Better bonusing. Better salary as numbers increase.

pros:
Chiropractors get to be chiropractors and not have the worry of staffing, billing, or overhead.
High volume allows for enhancing adjusting skills.
cons:
Working side by side with a chiropractor that you may not philosophically agree with.
Patients looking for a emergency care, due to lack of funds and insurance.

pros: Flexible hours, free adjustments, good pay, easy job standards
cons: corporate issues causing confusion between accounts

review_title: Needs more consistency across all offices
years_at_company: Needs more consistency across all offices
pros: Fairly low-stress job, sales aren't too difficult, can pick up shifts if need be.
cons: Completely depends on the owner for how offices are run: salary, bonus structure(if have one), weekly schedule, if they market or not, if you have a competent wellness coordinator, if you can get off work.
advice_to_mgmt: Corporate office and clinic owners need to listen to the chiropractors, as many of them know how to run an office and what works and what doesn't.

pros: Hard hours, No outside billing work, no medical coding, no interference from insurance
cons: Reduced pay for physicians, physical demands on body, rapid change from management
advice_to_mgmt: Notify physicians of changes before customers.

pros: I have a great owner of the businesses that is engaged and understanding. Corporate is happy to give any support that is needed. They are proactively creating tools needed to do our Jobs better. The clinic staffs are small so it is more like a family environment. We are also helping our patients feel better everyday!
cons: Growing pains. But that's normal for a business that is growing! Corporates communications are much appreciated to keep us up to speed on these processes and powering through the solutions.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue communicating. Power through the growing pains. Hopefully we will stabilize. Yeah, it can be frustrating on the in clinic level - but we see you all are proactively trying to solve problems.

pros: I love working for The Joint! I am both a former and current employee of The Joint as I started my practice of chiropractic at a different location than I currently work. I started with The Joint right out of school and after 2 years decided I wanted to check out other options for practice in the chiropractic profession. I was deeply disappointed. So, after a year of what I like to call “soul searching,” I found my way back to The Joint in Greenville, SC on Woodruff Rd. I love what I do, I love my employer, I love the people I work with, and I love our patients! My favorite thing about working at The Joint is our mission: to improve quality of life through routine and affordable chiropractic care. I believe EVERYONE needs chiropractic care and my heart is that everyone has access to affordable care and that is exactly what The Joint provides.
cons: The only potential “con” of working at The Joint is that there is a large misconception of what exactly it is that we do to make it so affordable. In the chiropractic community the misconception is that at The Joint we have a lower standard of care. I can tell you from experience that this is false. In fact, I believe we have an even higher standard of care than most privately owned and operated offices. We have an amazing compliance team that does an excellent job of making sure that we stay up to date with all the laws and that our patient notes are adequate and complete.
advice_to_mgmt: If you want to be the best, work with the best!

review_title: Easy model and fulfilling to really help patients instead of getting tied up with insurance.
years_at_company: Easy model and fulfilling to really help patients instead of getting tied up with insurance.
pros: Only wellness care, happy patients, beautiful offices, good pay and very little stress. Also great for new grads who want to learn how to run a cash based business well.
cons: There aren't many but it is different than a regular office because it's open seven days a week and usually 9 hours a day so you can't always leave the office for a break (although there is down time for a break in the office).

pros: The company is doing a great job of bringing in new patients to chiropractic who have never seen a chiropractor before. I like this because more people need to know there are better solutions than just running to drugs or surgery. Also, the compensation is great when you factor in not having to do insurance documentation and all the other crap we have to do to run our own practice.
cons: Company needs to upgrade their IT systems
advice_to_mgmt: Keep growing through smart expansion of the existing services and work on ways to smooth out the patient flow.

pros: I love the concept. I love the people. I feel like I am making a difference!
cons: Need for greater communication and support between departments
advice_to_mgmt: Protect your people! They are your greatest asset.

review_title: Great company with a bright future!!!
years_at_company: Great company with a bright future!!!
pros: Growing company with plenty of opportunity to influence growth and direction. Fantastic mission statement- it is awesome to be part of a business with a positive impact on quality of life for our patients. Great team of committed employees who support one another!
cons: Not the best fit for everyone. Need to be comfortable with ambiguity and change. Benefits and compensation could be better.

review_title: Chiropractic care as it should be!
years_at_company: Chiropractic care as it should be!
pros: Cutting edge, innovative, patient focused
cons: Peers in the profession have not done their research to see how much we have improved the way the public views chiropractic care.

pros: Not stressful, free chiropractic adjustments
cons: Long days sometimes with a lot of down time. Management tries to keep you busy with phone and social media tasks.
advice_to_mgmt: Improve management.

pros: Great open environment. Reasonable treatment. Great price for customers. Very efficient computer system.
cons: They were always switching the pay scale of commissions and bonuses. Very pressured to sell large packages/memberships even to those who didn't need.
advice_to_mgmt: Focus on quality not quantity for sells.

pros: Evolving, growing organization, with lots of opportunity to contribute
cons: You have to love a fast pace!

pros: Both the Mission and Vision of the company revolves around bringing quality of life a little closer to reality for the masses.
cons: We can only grow as quickly as we can spread the word on wellness
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the great work!

pros:
+ Everyone is so kind!
+ Management is super friendly and always an email away!
+ The chiropractors are all very nice!
+ Good pay.
+ Everyone on the team feels like a family!
cons: - There isn't a "lunch break" so you'll have to eat when you're not too busy with patients!
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the good work! You guys are awesome!

review_title: If you have to work, do it somewhere awesome!
years_at_company: If you have to work, do it somewhere awesome!
pros:
Great mission and values- Employees genuinely believe in the value of chiropractic care
Approachable, knowledgeable, management team
Small company, ability to interact with lots of different people
Flexible work environment/no micromanagement
Fully stocked kitchen, team gatherings once a month
Great team to work with!
Free chiropractic memberships for employees and their immediate families
Good location! Who doesn’t love a short commute?!
cons:
Some opportunities to improve benefits- ie. 401(k) Match
Corporate bonus program has not been achievable- demotivating
Time to reward top performers with merit increases
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the great work!

review_title: There is no I in team.
years_at_company: There is no I in team.
pros: Great group of people to work with, everyone is willing to pitch in an help even when tasks are outside of their scope of work. There has been some turnover but I think we have a good group with positive attitudes moving the company in the right direction.
cons: With so many employees spread over the country, not everyone has the same experience. The benefits package (PTO in particular) could use some work!

review_title: Clinic Director and Doctor of Chiropractic
years_at_company: Clinic Director and Doctor of Chiropractic
pros: Easy schedule, No insurance hassle
cons: Very little respect from management and patients.

review_title: This little company has come a long way...and has a very bright future!
years_at_company: This little company has come a long way...and has a very bright future!
pros:
-Growth oriented
-Great people with great attitudes to work with
-The mission of what the company stands for is admirable
-The core values are followed and promoted by each member of the corporate staff
-The company is stable and almost profitable
-Intelligent and frugal financial management, helps insure longevity of the organization and profit to shareholders
-Work/life balance in more in check than not
-Wellness program, free adjustments for staff and family
cons:
-Benefits: Vacation time is horrible, no match on 401(k)
-Compensation is low compared to the workload
-Not a lot of flexibility, people spend way too much time chained to a desk starring at a computer screen, this kills creativity and motivation. Not to mention, goes against all Chiropractic principles of a healthy spine/lifestyle
-SR. mgmt likes to talk to much about himself, doesn't focus enough on empowering the team. Spends too much time talking about what he did at MBE.
-Leadership needs to take a stance against franchisees who don't exemplify the core values. There are still franchisees who think its ok to disrespect corp. employees to get their own way. Compliance by franchisees is a big problem that needs attention
advice_to_mgmt: Spend less time talking about accomplishments of the past and "sayings", spend more time empowering and leading the team

pros: Great Chiropractors! Develop relationship with regulars, great stepping stone for higher admin. job
cons: Long hours, Medicare questions required to ask takes people aback, patients complain about the amount of paperwork constantly.

pros: Growing company with lots of opportunity. The work atmosphere at corporate is phenomenal with lots of really great employees.
cons: The environment is not for everyone and since it is a small company you take on a lot of different job duties.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep the employees and franchisees engaged while continuing to drive the company towards profitability.

review_title: Great team, working towards common goal
years_at_company: Great team, working towards common goal
pros: I'm fortunate to work with such a great group of motivated people. I enjoy coming to work everyday, and am constantly presented with new challenges that keep the job interesting. This Company is primed for great things, and I look forward to its growth.
cons: Looking forward to the continued improvement in the fringe benefits as the Company grows
advice_to_mgmt: Invest in some more Scattergories boards, we're starting to repeat the lists during the social events!

review_title: Great Company & Employees, Company Set-Up for Success
years_at_company: Great Company & Employees, Company Set-Up for Success
pros: The Joint Corp. is demonstrating consecutive quarters of revenue & profitability growth, lots of opportunity to be involved outside of your normal scope of responsibilities, corporate team has been built from the ground up of skilled leaders that are dedicated and truly making a difference.
cons: The Joint Corp. is a growth company and change is certain, must be able to adapt as the company evolves.
advice_to_mgmt: Stay focused on executing.

review_title: The Joint improves quality of life of patients and employees
years_at_company: The Joint improves quality of life of patients and employees
pros: Nice culture. Supportive, friendly team.
cons: Lots to do to keep you busy. Not the place for someone who wants to check their social media all day.

pros:
Team that truly believes in helping people access affordable care.
Great location with nice office space
Lots of change, never a dull day. Job is interesting, you wear a lot of hats
The culture is to work hard, CEO works hard too
No micromanagement, positive attitudes
Fully stocked kitchen for all staff
Free adjustments
cons:
The HQ team is lean, pace affects work/life balance.
Few processes in place, takes a lot to get things done
Eat lunch at your desk culture, feels like a break is not ok

pros: Excellent workplace, opportunity, people and leadership
cons: Total compensation and benefits not competitive.
advice_to_mgmt: Need to improve benefits and compensation.

pros:
- Great mission, where else do you get to improve people's quality of life every day?
- Fun environment
- Work with great people
- Flexible, family friendly
- Small team, easy access to anyone you want to work with and opportunities to work on a variety of things
cons: - Lots of change, might not be for everyone
advice_to_mgmt: Yes we need to get to the all mighty "break even" but we need the great people on this team to do that so it's time to recognize and reward employees that deserve it.

review_title: Perfect company for those who love to make a difference!
years_at_company: Perfect company for those who love to make a difference!
pros: Team-oriented and very open to ideas and strategies aligned with helping grow our brand and increase the overall customer experience.
cons: There aren't more clinics nationwide - yet! We are consistently expanding year after year.
advice_to_mgmt: Everyone appreciates the energy put into keeping us informed on all aspects of our company - it matters, so keep it up :)

review_title: Doctor of Chiropractic and chief of staff
years_at_company: Doctor of Chiropractic and chief of staff
pros: helping and improving the quality of people's life everyday
cons: long hours other than that its great
advice_to_mgmt: better patient care by taking more time to see whats the ongoing problem with patient

review_title: Low pay, boring job and the management listens to the Staff and not the doctors. Treated horribly by owner and manager!
years_at_company: Low pay, boring job and the management listens to the Staff and not the doctors. Treated horribly by owner and manager!
pros: Easy job, no paperwork. Great for a seasonal job until you find a permanent position.
cons: No lunch break. I doubled the collections and patient base and was let go for not cleaning well enough, getting nasty emails on my days off from management and staff. I was the 3rd doctor they turned over in 4 months. They actually fired the doctor I replaced while I waited in the parking lot. I'm so relieved I am back in my own practice in a respectable environment. Now I can be a real chiropractor again!
advice_to_mgmt: Owner knows little about Chiropractic and medical director plays favorites to doctors he hangs out with socially. Get priorities in order. Patient care and practice growth.

pros: The culture is to work hard. There is not a single person in the company who is not working hard to achieve common goals! There is practically no micro management.
cons: Work life balance can be difficult to come by but the company is growing, so all the hard work will pay off!

pros: Hours are great, 10-7. It is pretty laid back.
cons: There is no room to move up, no paid holidays or vacation days. Money is not good

pros: Free chiropractic care, above minimum wage pay, 6-8 hour days.
cons: No growth, You could be the best seller and still not grow at all within the company or your pay. They will take every last minute of your time, I once worked 14 days in a row and they still asked me to cover more until I refused. Many doctors are rude, almost every manager has been unkind, rude etc.
advice_to_mgmt: Hire people who can actually manage and care to help the employees as that is their job, give credit where it is due.

pros: Helping members with their health, great doctors (at my location) easy learning curve, free adjustments!
cons: Not very challenging, long hours, no breaks, low pay, zero benefits
advice_to_mgmt: Consider increasing the Wellness Coordinator pay to actually retain good employees

pros: Good for experience right out of school but not ideal for long term.
cons: Revolving door of doctors and wellness consultants. No benefits offered for the doctors. Schedule is constantly changing and poor management with individual franchise ownership. All they care about is conversions because it's a case only practice so if you don't get a patient to buy a package then they wonder what is wrong with you. You can hear everything being said from patients to doctor conversations as well as wellness consultants trying to close patient. The cliTnic never close during the day for lunch so doctors feel rushed for a 30min lunch if a full 8hr day and you don't get a break if you work less than than that. The wellness consultants have to eat at their desk.

pros: Fun work environment. You build great relationships with patients and staff.
cons: I'm pretty sure corporate couldn't pick out their employees in a line up, as a result, you feel very undervalued as an employee. They will give "incentives" but then create goals so unattainable that you never see the pay off. In short, its sales position wrapped in a chiropractic clinic. Very high turnover rate because their employees know they are just a place filler but they'll never admit that it ever has to do with the horrible management they put in place. There is no work/life balance, you work 9 hour days with no break. It is a very short lived position because of the company structure, micromanagement is their management style
advice_to_mgmt: Honor your employees, they are the ones doing the work. If you take care of them, they'll take care of your clinics. Stop promoting individuals who are incompetent and ill-equipped to manage your front office. You aren't seeing the numbers you want because your employees are miserable.
